channel.title: AI & Labor Market Research Database
channel.description: A curated collection of economics papers on the labor market impact of AI and automation.

item.title: Generative AI at Work
item.description: Studies staggered deployment of AI chat assistant for ~5,000 customer support agents. Tool increased successfully resolved user chats by 15% per agent per hour.
item.author: Erik Brynjolfsson, Danielle Li, Lindsey R. Raymond

item.title: Experimental evidence on the productivity effects of generative AI
item.description: Gave 400+ college educated professionals writing tasks, half prompted to use ChatGPT. ChatGPT group took 37% less time on tasks.
item.author: Shakked Noy, Whitney Zhang

item.title: The Effects of Generative AI on High-Skilled Work
item.description: Pools three experiments randomizing access to Copilot among software engineers. Use of Copilot increased weekly completed tasks by 26%.
item.author: Kevin Z. Cui, Mert Demirer, Sonia Jaffe, Leon Musolff, Sida Peng, Tobias Salz

item.title: Large Language Models, Small Labor Market Effects
item.description: Examines labor impact of AI chatbots in Denmark. Finds zero effects of AI chatbot adoption on earnings or hours.
item.author: Anders Humlum, Emilie Vestergaard

item.title: Canaries in the Coal Mine? Six Facts about the Recent Employment Effects of AI
item.description: Uses ADP payroll data to examine changes since the release of generative AI. Early career workers saw a 13% decline in employment.
item.author: Erik Brynjolfsson, Bharat Chandar, Ruyu Chen

item.title: Navigating the Jagged Technological Frontier
item.description: RCT with ~750 BCG consultants. For tasks within AI capabilities, consultants with AI access completed 12% more tasks, 25% faster.
item.author: Fabrizio Dell'Acqua, Edward McFowland III, Ethan R. Mollick

item.title: AI and Jobs: A review of theory, estimates, and evidence
item.description: Surveys studies of AI impact on productivity. Finds gains are 20-60% in RCTs, 15-30% in field experiments.
item.author: R. Maria del Rio-Chanona, Ekkehard Ernst, Rossana Merola, Daniel Samaan, Ole Teutloff

item.title: Generative AI and labour productivity: a field experiment on coding
item.description: Experiment at Ant Group involving ~1,200 coders. Group with access to LLM saw a 53% increase in code production.
item.author: Leonardo Gambacorta, Han Qiu, Shuo Shan, Daniel Rees

item.title: AI and Jobs: The Final Word (Until the Next One)
item.description: Finds no aggregate effects of generative AI on the labor force in analysis of CPS data from 2022 to 2025.
item.author: Sarah E. Eckhardt, Nathan Goldschlag

item.title: Artificial Intelligence and the Labor Market
item.description: Develops new measure of task-level exposure to AI from 2010 to 2023.
item.author: Menaka Hampole, Dimitris Papanikolaou, Lawrence D.W. Schmidt, Bryan Seegmiller

item.title: The Short-Term Effects of Generative Artificial Intelligence on Employment
item.description: Uses Upwork data to analyze freelancers before and after release of ChatGPT, DALL-E 2, and Midjourney.
item.author: Xiang Hui, Oren Reshef, Luofeng Zhou

item.title: Generative AI and Labor Market Outcomes: Evidence from the United Kingdom
item.description: Finds the most exposed UK firms experienced a 4.5% fall in total employment relative to firms without exposure.
item.author: Bouke Klein Teeselink

item.title: Winners and losers of generative AI: Early Evidence of Shifts in Freelancer Demand
item.description: Uses freelancing platform data to categorize skills as substitutable, complementary, or unaffected by LLMs.
item.author: Ole Teutloff, Johanna Einsiedler, Otto Kässi, Fabian Braesemann, Pamela Mishkin, R. Maria del Rio-Chanona

item.title: Generative AI as Seniority-Biased Technological Change
item.description: In firms that hire AI integrators, employment for junior workers in AI-exposed roles declines sharply.
item.author: Guy Lichtinger, Seyed Hosseini

item.title: The (Short-Term) Effects of LLMs on Unemployment and Earnings
item.description: Finds that ChatGPT raised earnings for workers in highly exposed occupations by an average of $89 per week.
item.author: Danqing Chen, Carina Kane, Austin Kozlowski, Nadav Kunievsky, James A. Evans

item.title: Evaluating the Impact of AI on the Labor Market: Current State of Affairs
item.description: Broad look at AI impact on US labor market from late 2022 to late 2025. No discernible disruption to aggregate labor market.
item.author: Martha Gimbel, Molly Kinder, Joshua Kendall, Maddie Lee

item.title: Advancing AI Capabilities and Evolving Labor Outcomes
item.description: Using a novel measure of AI exposure, finds a 10 point increase is associated with a 5-8pp decline in employment.
item.author: Jacob Dominski, Yong Suk Lee

item.title: The Labor Market Effects of Generative Artificial Intelligence
item.description: Survey found LLM use at work rose from 30% in Dec 2024 to 46% in June/July 2025.
item.author: Jonathan Hartley, Filip Jolevski, Vitor Melo, Brendan Moore

item.title: Assessing early labor market effects of generative AI
item.description: Used data on all wage earners in Finland to assess ChatGPT impact. Finds no significant differences in changes in wage or employment.
item.author: Antti Kauhanen, Petri Rouvinen

item.title: Artificial intelligence, hiring and employment: job postings evidence from Sweden
item.description: Combines universal Swedish employment data from 2014-2022 with AI exposure measure.
item.author: Erik Engberg, Mark Hellsten, Farrukh Javed, Magnus Lodefalk, Radka Sabolová, Sarah Schroeder
